title: Repairing the Split Between the Arts and the Trades

transcript_parts.text: as you can see I'm standing in a new
location this is an area in my garage
which my workshop where I do stuff that
I've cleaned up and made look
presentable enough to film some video in
and that is because I'm working a lot on
this trade school project that I've
talked a little bit about
and one of the really interesting things
that I learned in my reading and
research
I came from this book
skinny little book called Art needs no
justification by Hans Rook mocker and I
guess this was really just based off of
like a lecture he gave or something but
um it's really interesting because he
talks about how
there was kind of a split around the
Renaissance or you know a little before
like the enlightenment kind of period
where
um there was a split in
uh culture I guess you could say between
the high Arts like painting and
sculpture
and um probably like architecture and
then like the lower craft trades like
building houses and furniture and
um making more practical things but
prior to that
the artists or the Craftsman was really
the same person and it was the same
person that you would hire to build
a bench or to paint a mural in your
house
and
as I've been thinking about
um that you know it's very interesting
because I think on the one hand
you look at someone like Jonathan Cujo
and and he was pursuing a career in the
Arts
and found it very
difficult to navigate spiritually
whereas
if you look at um
most people in like the construction
trades these are people that tend to
have very solid stable normal lives
but we probably under appreciate their
knowledge and wisdom and in fact that's
kind of a big reason behind the
um concept for this project is that I
believe that there are Godly men full of
wisdom who are working on these trades
and we tend to overlook them and we
undervalue them as a resource to help
build up the Next Generation
but you know as I'm approaching that I
think one part of um
remedying that problem is to bring back
this
um division that was caused and to
realize like
um if you work
in some sort of a building trade you are
just as much an artist in a way and
and you know it's different because
you're not necessarily making things
just for people to look at but there is
a beauty you know I think like Engineers
understand this because there's a beauty
in things that are well designed but
there's also a beauty in uh somebody who
you know frames a house really
efficiently and really consistently and
and does all those things and so you
know the pride of craftsmanship I think
applies to all things but
um
but I think also there is probably more
room than a lot of people realize in
like the Building Trades to be creative
and
helping people realize that's okay and
that's a part of it and this is probably
something that most of the people
working in this in the trades have
discovered on their own they may not
articulate it in that way
but I think it's something that we need
to talk about because
it it
adds another layer to this conversation
where doing a job like that is not just
about the stability it's not just about
the sense of accomplishment or uh just
the you know the steady solid life that
you can build around it but it is a
fulfilling thing and I've I've noticed
this as well in my own work career
it's a little different because
sometimes people won't notice like for
instance if I'm touching up something on
a cabinet
uh the point of my best artistic
abilities is for you to not notice
a defect that was there and so nobody's
going to give you praise for that unless
if they saw
what was before
and sometimes even stupid stuff like
we're gonna we're gonna replace this but
the house is closing before the parts
are going to come in so we just want you
to make it look good for now and then
we'll replace it which is like well
that's kind of a
um
silly thing in some ways but it's it's
still strangely fulfilling to kind of
know that you've you've pulled it off
and um I think that they're that that
sort of feeling is there whenever
whenever you find a problem and you're
able to work through a solution in a
creative way
so
um
that was something I had to think is
just a universally applicable and needed
to something we need to think about and
consider more it also really expands
the amount of applicable materials
because there's a lot more
books and and things written about how
creative Pursuits help us to connect to
God
and I don't think that people realize
that these Building Trades and things
like that or even just you know
household tasks can very much
you can apply the same things to that
it's it's slightly different but it's
really
the in the same core way of thinking of
things
so
um
for those who are interested I am very
close to kind of launching officially
but I have set up a Discord Channel and
I've invited a few people who are kind
of looking stuff over there's some rough
drafts and materials and some videos and
things that are
available now so I'm not going to put a
link publicly
yet it will be coming soon but if
anybody is friends with me on Discord or
is it in the same uh Discord communities
where I'll share this video and you're
interested in a sneak peek of what I'm
doing in my progress you want to
contribute it in some way feel free to
DM me and I will send you an invite to
that Discord server so thanks for
watching and hope this is enjoyable
